steps.title: Launch app
details: All tests begin by navigating to http://localhost:5173 and see the dashboard.

steps.title: Add a new task
details: Users open the “Add Task” modal and fill in name, description, deadline, category, colour, emoji.
Visual issues reported in every modal step (inconsistent typography, spacing, button style).

HARD FAILURE: In the Drag & Move Task scenario, the Create Task button cannot be clicked because the open category dropdown intercepts the click (step 8 ‑ fail) – flow blocks and later steps stay pending.

steps.title: Re-order (Drag & Move)
details: Because task creation fails, user never reaches drag-and-drop steps (steps 9-16 pending).

steps.title: Mark task as done
details: User can mark a task complete and sees it leave the active list, but screenshots suggest visual feedback is subtle; many “no confirmation message observed” notes.

steps.title: Mark task as NOT done
details: User re-opens a completed task; UI changes back correctly, but no toast/notification appears (step 6 fail).

steps.title: Pin a task
details: User attempts to pin a task; actions recorded, but final verification step remains pending – no clear indicator that pin was successful (step 15 pending).

steps.title: View task details
details: Task-details modal opens from three-dot menu; information appears accurate, though labels mis-aligned.

steps.title: Edit a task
details: User goes through edit flow; fields accept changes and Save seems to work, but logs show repeated uncertainty about whether Save was really clicked or reflected in list (weak feedback).

steps.title: Add new category
details: Entire test stuck in ‘pending’ – category management flow may not be implemented or navigation isn’t obvious.

emotional_arc: Starts confident (app loads), mild annoyance grows with sloppy visual spacing. A spike of frustration hits when the Create Task button is un-clickable. Subsequent tasks work but lack success messages, leaving the shopper uncertain. Re-open / pin flows feel unfinished, creating lingering doubt rather than delight.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Blocking element over the Create Task button prevents core action; users think the app is broken.
next_actions: Close dropdown automatically when an option is picked OR disable it before showing other buttons.
Add z-index audit/tests so popovers don’t intercept clicks.
Include visual cue when a dropdown is still open.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users repeatedly see no toast, badge or list update and question whether actions succeeded.
next_actions: Show toast/snackbar for Create, Edit, Pin, Mark-done/undone.
Animate list insertion/re-ordering so change is obvious.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent UI erodes trust and makes forms harder to scan.
next_actions: Adopt design tokens / theme system; use single type scale and spacing scale.
Create shared Button and Input components; replace ad-hoc styles.
Run automated linting (Stylelint) and visual regression tests.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast colours hurt readability and fail WCAG; dropdown intercept issue is also a focus trap risk.
next_actions: Run Lighthouse/axe audit; adjust primary & category colours to meet 4.5:1 contrast.
Ensure focus outline visible on all interactive elements.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: User can’t tell if edits or second task creation succeeded; uncertainty lowers confidence.
next_actions: After successful API response, scroll task into view and briefly highlight it.
Ensure optimistic UI update before network round-trip.

first_tackles.description: Fix dropdown popover intercepting Create Task click (close on select or raise z-index).
Add universal toast/snackbar for success & error states (Create, Edit, Pin, etc.).
Introduce shared Button & Input components to unify typography, padding and colours quickly.
Improve colour contrast of text & category chips to meet WCAG AA.
Auto-collapse modal / highlight new task in list to reassure users action worked.
